name: Herbaceous Perennial
description: Plants with non-woody stems that die back to the ground each year but regrow from the roots.

name: Climber Wall Shrub
description: Plants that climb or trail along walls or other structures, often with woody stems.

name: Bedding
description: Annual or perennial plants commonly used for decorative purposes in flower beds.

name: Bulbs
description: Plants that grow from underground storage structures called bulbs, producing flowers or foliage.

name: Ferns
description: Non-flowering vascular plants with feathery or leathery leaves, reproducing via spores.

name: Shrubs
description: Woody plants with multiple stems and persistent foliage, generally smaller than trees.

name: Annual Biennial
description: Plants that complete their life cycle in one or two years, respectively, often flowering and setting seed in the second year.

name: Alpine Rockery
description: Plants adapted to alpine or rocky environments, often low-growing and tolerant of poor soil conditions.

name: Roses
description: Flowering plants of the genus Rosa, prized for their fragrant blooms and often grown for ornamental purposes.

name: Grass Like
description: Plants resembling grass in appearance or growth habit, but not necessarily belonging to the grass family.

name: Conservatory Greenhouse
description: Plants suited for indoor cultivation in controlled environments like conservatories or greenhouses.

name: Fruit Edible
description: Plants grown for their edible fruits, including trees, shrubs, and vines.

name: Trees
description: Woody plants usually with a single stem or trunk, characterized by a longer lifespan and greater height compared to shrubs.

name: Houseplants
description: Plants cultivated indoors for decorative or functional purposes.

name: Cactus Succulent
description: Plants adapted to arid environments, characterized by water-storing tissues and reduced leaves.

name: Aquatic
description: Plants adapted to live in water or in waterlogged soil.

name: Bamboos
description: Tall, woody grasses belonging to the subfamily Bambusoideae, known for their rapid growth and versatile uses.

name: Bogs
description: Plants adapted to acidic and waterlogged environments, often found in peatlands or bogs.

name: Conifers
description: Gymnospermous plants with needle-like or scale-like leaves and typically producing cones.

name: Herbs - Culinary
description: Plants cultivated for culinary, medicinal, or aromatic purposes, often characterized by soft, non-woody stems.

name: Palms
description: Tropical or subtropical plants with a characteristic unbranched stem and large, often feather-shaped leaves.
